comments:
Build: 3.0 RC2

I have a launch configuration on my large self-hosting workspace to launch a 
runtime workbench. I copied this workspace to a different machine. The launch 
still worked fine, but source lookup is now broken. When I try to add projects 
to the launch configuration's source lookup path, I get an exception in the log:

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

Created an attachment (id=12300)
Log file showing stack traces

Looking back in my log, I see more errors involving source lookup. It appears
that this launch configuration had some source lookup entries on drive D:. My
new machine does not have a D: drive, so this caused failures during source
lookup.

Created an attachment (id=12301)
Zipped log file

Sorry, the previous attachment was the wrong log file. The actual log file is
quite large, so I have zipped it up.

Created an attachment (id=12303)
patch

The log contains many source lookup exceptions - but they are handled. The out
of bounds problem is a simple fix - we were checking for a null array but not
an empty array. Attached patch addressed problem.
Marking as RC3 candidate, pining DJ for approval.

Aren't we all pining for DJ? From the "pining" entry in Merriam-Webster:

2 : to yearn intensely and persistently especially for something unattainable
<they were still pining for their lost wealth>

I guess the potential pool of "desireable yet unattainable" is limited in 
Winnipeg :-)

Geesh...a guy steps out of the office to run a few errands and he's being trash
talked from the east coast to the west?? :-)

Fix looks good.

I'll send you guys an autographed photo via internal mail next week. :-)
